greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n, k) is the number of forests with n (unlabeled) nodes and k planted trees.
comment: The number of planted trees with n+1 nodes is equal to the number of rooted trees with n nodes. [See Palmer-Schwenk link, pp. 115].
link: E. M. Palmer and A. J. Schwenk, On the number of trees in a random forest, J. Combin. Theory, B 27 (1979), 109-121.
Index entries for sequences related to rooted trees
formula: T(1,1) = 0, if n >= 2 T(n,k) = Sum_{P_1(n,k)}( Product_{j=2..n} binomial(A000081(j-1) + c_j - 1, c_j) ), where P_1(n, k) is the set of the partitions of n with k parts greater than one: 2*c_2 + ... + n*c_n = n; c_2, ..., c_n >= 0.
If k > floor(n/2), T(n,k) = 0; otherwise T(n,k) = A033185(n-k, k).
program: (PARI) g(m) = {my(f); if(m==0, return(1)); f = vector(m+1); f[1]=1;
for(j=1, m, f[j+1]=1/j * sum(k=1, j, sumdiv(k,d, d * f[d]) * f[j-k+1])); f[m+1] };
F(n,t)={my(s=0, D, c, P_1); if(n==1,return(0)); forpart(P_1 = n, D = Set(P_1); c = vector(#D); for(k=1, #D, c[k] = #select(x->x == D[k], Vec(P_1)));
results.author: _Washington Bomfim_, Jul 08 2020
